findings.title: Coarse-grained Access Control; Data Inconsistency
findings.description: The setPool function in the LiquidityGaugePool contract grants entities with the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE extensive power to modify vital parameters of the _poolInfo struct.

findings.title: Unverifiable Logic
findings.description: The LiquidityGaugePoolReward contractâ€™s _updateVotingPowers function relies on out-of-scope contracts, making it challenging to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Denial Of Service; Highly Permissive Owner Access
findings.description: The current implementation of the platform fee lacks constraints, permitting it to be set to any value, including values exceeding 100%.

findings.title: Undocumented Functionality
findings.description: The DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE can alter vital parameters, leading to potential unintended consequences.

findings.title: Missing Storage Gaps
findings.description: Lack of storage gaps to allow for storage extension during upgrades.

findings.title: Highly Permissive Owner Access
findings.description: Entities with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE permissions can modify crucial variables, even after users have made deposits into the pool.

findings.title: Mishandled Edge Case
findings.description: The deposit function updates the `_lastDepositHeights` for a user every time they deposit tokens, unintentionally extending the withdrawal lockup period.

findings.title: Unrestricted Token Recovery
findings.description: The recoverToken function grants entities with the _NS_ROLES_RECOVERY_AGENT role the power to withdraw any token from the contract.

findings.title: Race Condition
findings.description: The `_withdrawRewards` function calculates the platformFee based on the current state of the `_poolInfo.platformFee` variable, which can be changed by an admin between transaction initiation and mining.

findings.title: Lack of Emergency Withdrawal Mechanism
findings.description: The LiquidityGaugePool contract does not feature a mechanism for emergency withdrawals, excluding rewards.

findings.title: CEI Pattern Violation
findings.description: A CEI pattern violation has been detected in the deposit function, although it doesn't immediately present a reentrancy risk.

findings.title: Redundant Complexity (L02)
findings.description: Manual specification of epoch numbers can lead to irregular epoch numbers.

findings.title: Informational - Floating Pragma (I01)
findings.description: Using floating pragmas may result in contracts being deployed with the wrong pragma version
findings.location: All files in the src/gauge-pool/ directory

findings.title: Informational - Solidity Style Guides Violation (I02)
findings.description: Inconsistent ordering and naming conventions in contracts.

findings.title: Unnecessary Functionality (I03)
findings.description: Inheritance from WithPausability.sol leads to unnecessary functionality.

findings.title: Accumulation of Dust Values (I04)
findings.description: Rounding behavior in setEpoch() function may lead to accumulation of small discrepancies in token amounts.
